The CCP continues to use vaccines as a propaganda tool against Taiwan. But its tone has changed from last monthâ€™s harsh criticism to a softer appeal since the beginning of June. In last weekâ€™s report, IORG had found that the CCP disseminated narratives such as â€œAmerica hasnâ€™t sold a single dose of vaccines to Taiwanâ€ and â€œThe DPPâ€™s refusal to open up for Chinese vaccines is due to political demonsâ€ in an attempt to divide Taiwan-US relations. But in the first two weeks of June, the theme has changed to â€œTaiwanese go to China to get vaccinated.â€ For example, Chinese state media Global Times cites the words of XU Zheng-wen (å¾æ­£æ–‡), head of Taiwanese Chamber of Commerce in China, that getting vaccinated in China is more convenient than doing it in America. The spokesperson of Chinaâ€™s Taiwan Affairs Office also claims that â€œThere have been 62,000 Taiwanese vaccinated in China.â€

XU Zheng-wen (å¾æ­£æ–‡) is a former member of the Central Committee of the KMT and a former guest member of the Beijing Municipal Committee. He provoked controversy in February 2020 by inserting people who caught COVID-19 to a group that took a designated plane heading back to Taiwan.
